page.title: 08THE VILLAGE OF ROWARTH
page.content: Rowarth has just one shop and that is a post office.There used to be a church but that was knocked down.It is a little countryside village.The Childrens Inn used to be called the Hare and Hounds where coach riders would stop overnight and change their horses for the Manchester to Derby coach road.There is an old monastery which is now a farmhouse.A monk is buried under the floor of the barn. The Hare and Hounds was used until 1928 now it is a childrens holiday home.The little mill pub is in Rowarth It was once a corn mill.Further up the road there is an old water mill but there is no longer a water wheel.There is a mill pond which runs smoothly until a fast flowing drop.Lantern Pike overlooks Rowarth.There are no trains or buses going to or from Rowarth so you would need your own transport.
